answerText: efficiency[10] The maximum theoretical efficiency is achieved by this four-stage heat cycle developed by its French namesake in 1824, which does work via isothermal expansion at the hot reservoir temperature in its first stage.
heading: ICCS |2014 | 3 | 17 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Given two heat reservoirs at a hot temperature of T1 and a cold temperature of T2, this quantity is given by one minus T2 over T1.  [10] Identify this dimensionless quantity usually symbolized by the Greek letter eta which represents the maximal useful output obtainable from a heat engine.
